document_data.name: ''Eyes of Minute Seeing''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Eyes of minute seeing''''' were enchanted [[lenses]] that allowed the users to see even the faintest details hidden from plain sight.
document_data.Description: ''Eyes of minute seeing'' had no distinct features in its appearance, looking the same as other types of enchanted lenses.
document_data.Powers:
These magical optic aides allowed the user to see a hundred times better up close, at a distance of {{SI|1'|'"|long=yes}} or less. These items' magic made it possible to discern the smallest seams, markings, details, or even impressions on paper or parchment. With the use of ''eyes of minute seeing,'' one could easily notice hidden compartments, secret mechanisms, or hidden joints.

The effect of using one of the ''eyes of minute seeing'' was similar to the effects of the ''[[eyes of the eagle]]'' spell.
document_data.History:
These objects were examples of the objects that could be created by following the instructions that the ''Maior Creare'' [[Nether Scrolls]] could bestow.

Before the fall of [[Myth Drannor]] in [[714 DR]], the City of Song's Court Magi carried ''eyes of minute seeing'' as a part of their standard gear.

''Circa'' [[1489 DR]], a kaleidoscopic monocle that was a variation of ''eyes of minute seeing'', was brought to [[Toril]]'s [[Icewind Dale]] onboard of the crushed [[nautiloid]] [[Id Ascendant]]. The enchanted monocle could be found in the captain's quarters of the [[spelljammer]].
document_data.Notable Owners:
*[[Ecaeris Aunglor]]: an [[elf|elven]] Spell-Captain of per-[[Weeping War]] Myth Drannor who was known for her perfectionism and attraction to [[human]]s and the [[arcane]].
*[[Jannaxil Serpentil]]: the proprietor of [[Serpentil Books & Folios]] in [[Waterdeep]] ''circa'' mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].
*[[Torm]]: an adventuring [[thief]] member of the [[Knights of Myth Drannor]] owned numerous magical gadgets, including ''eyes of minute seeing''.
